availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William D. Conley (Grant County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Father of Emily F. Conley and Julia A. Conley. Married to Elizabeth C. Ford Conley in Grant County, Kentucky on January 24, 1852. Father of Alice Conley, Benton Conley, Isolina Conley, Charles Conley, Sallie Conley, Davis Conley, James B. Conley, and Robert L. Conley. Farmer in Grant County in 1850. Farmer in Grant County in 1860. Owned one enslaved individual in Grant County in 1850. Owned four enslaved individuals in Grant County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 324A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 3 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 894.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Flat Creek, p. 546B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Grant County Marriages, Film #000266220, p. 12 of microfilm.
